Detailed Description

Function Documentation

CGPoint CPAlignPointToUserSpace ( CGContextRef  context,
CGPoint  p 
)

Aligns a point in user space to integral coordinates in device space.

Ensures that the x and y coordinates are at a pixel corner in device space. Drawn from Programming with Quartz by D. Gelphman, B. Laden.

Parameters:
context The graphics context.
p The point in user space.
Returns:
The device aligned point in user space.

CGRect CPAlignRectToUserSpace ( CGContextRef  context,
CGRect  r 
)

Aligns a rectangle in user space to integral coordinates in device space.

Ensures that the x and y coordinates are at a pixel corner in device space and the width and height are an integer number of device pixels. Drawn from Programming with Quartz by D. Gelphman, B. Laden.

Note:
This function produces a width and height that is less than or equal to the original width.
Parameters:
context The graphics context.
r The rectangle in user space.
Returns:
The device aligned rectangle in user space.

CGSize CPAlignSizeToUserSpace ( CGContextRef  context,
CGSize  s 
)

Adjusts a size in user space to integral dimensions in device space.

Ensures that the width and height are an integer number of device pixels. Drawn from Programming with Quartz by D. Gelphman, B. Laden.

Parameters:
context The graphics context.
s The size in user space.
Returns:
The device aligned size in user space.

NSDecimal CPDecimalNaN ( void   ) 

Creates and returns an NSDecimal struct that represents the value "not a number".

Calling NSDecimalIsNotANumber() on this value will return YES.

Returns:
An NSDecimal struct that represents the value "not a number".

NSRange CPExpandedRange ( NSRange  range,
NSInteger  expandBy 
)

Expands an NSRange by the given amount.

The location of the resulting NSRange will be non-negative.

Parameters:
range The NSRange to expand.
expandBy The amount the expand the range by.
Returns:
The expanded range.

CPCoordinate CPOrthogonalCoordinate ( CPCoordinate  coord  ) 

Determines the CPCoordinate that is orthogonal to the one provided.

The current implementation is two-dimensional--X is orthogonal to Y and Y is orthogonal to X.

Parameters:
coord The CPCoordinate.
Returns:
The orthogonal CPCoordinate.

CPRGBAColor CPRGBAColorFromCGColor ( CGColorRef  color  ) 

Extracts the color information from a CGColorRef and returns it as a CPRGBAColor.

Supports RGBA and grayscale colorspaces.

Parameters:
color The color.
Returns:
The RGBA components of the color.

NSString* CPStringFromPoint ( CGPoint  p  ) 

Creates a string representation of the given point.

Parameters:
p The point.
Returns:
A string with the format {x, y}.

NSString* CPStringFromRect ( CGRect  r  ) 

Creates a string representation of the given point.

Parameters:
r The rectangle.
Returns:
A string with the format {{x, y}, {width, height}}.

NSString* CPStringFromSize ( CGSize  s  ) 

Creates a string representation of the given point.

Parameters:
s The size.
Returns:
A string with the format {width, height}.
